newsitem.title: FRANCE: French June industrial output rose 0.5 pct.
newsitem.headline: French June industrial output rose 0.5 pct.

text.p: National statistics institute INSEE said on Wednesday industrial production, excluding construction, fell 0.2 percent in June from the previous month and was down 0.1 percent year-on-year. Industrial production excluding energy, agri-food businesses and construction -- considered by INSEE the best measure of manufacturing output -- rose 0.5 percent in June from the previous month, giving a year-on-year fall of 0.6 percent.
It gave the following seasonally-adjusted data based on a new index introduced in January 1996.
The previous index used a base year of 1985.
INSEE gave the following seasonally adjusted percentage changes:
Jun vs May May vs Apr yr/yr*

NOTE - Comparison with year-ago period is for three months to end June versus the three months in the same period last year. INSEE said on July 23 that industrial output excluding construction rose 0.5 percent in May from April while manufacturing output fell 0.2 percent.
